Adonai.note: Hebrew title meaning 'Lord,' used reverently to address God.

Almighty.note: Attribute emphasizing God's unlimited power and authority.

Beloved Son.note: Title referring to Jesus, emphasizing His special relationship with God the Father.

Christ.note: Greek translation of 'Messiah,' meaning 'Anointed One,' referring to Jesus.

Creator.note: Title emphasizing God as the origin and maker of all creation.

El Elyon.note: Hebrew title meaning 'God Most High,' emphasizing God's sovereignty.

El Olam.note: Hebrew title meaning 'Everlasting God,' emphasizing God's eternal nature.

El Shaddai.note: Hebrew title meaning 'God Almighty,' indicating God's power and sufficiency.

Elohim.note: Hebrew term for God, used to denote His supreme power and authority.

Father.note: Reference to God's paternal relationship with His creation and believers.

First and the Last.note: Title indicating God's eternal nature, encompassing all of time and existence.

God.note: Supreme being and creator of the universe, central figure of worship in biblical religion.

He.note: Pronoun referring to God, indicating His divine nature and authority.

His.note: Pronoun referring to God, indicating possession or relationship.

Holy One.note: Title highlighting God's absolute purity and holiness.

Holy Spirit.note: Third person of the Trinity, representing God's active presence and power.

I AM.note: Divine self-identification given to Moses, expressing God's eternal existence.

Jehovah.note: Traditional transliteration of YHWH, the personal and covenantal name of God in Hebrew.

Jesus.note: Central figure of Christianity, believed to be the incarnate Son of God, Savior of humanity.

Jesus Christ.note: Combination of 'Jesus' (Savior) and 'Christ' (Anointed One), emphasizing His divine mission.

Kyrios.note: Greek title meaning 'Lord,' used frequently in the New Testament referring to Jesus and God.

Lord.note: Title denoting authority and divinity, commonly applied to God and Jesus.

O Lord.note: Expression of reverence and supplication directed toward God.

Redeemer.note: Title emphasizing God’s role in liberating humanity from sin and spiritual bondage.

Savior.note: Refers to Jesus Christ as the one who delivers humanity from sin and eternal death.

Son.note: Refers specifically to Jesus Christ, highlighting His relationship as the Son of God.

Son of the Living God.note: Title affirming Jesus’ divine nature and unique relationship to God the Father.

Spirit of God.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit, indicating God’s active presence and influence.

Trinity.note: Christian doctrine expressing God as three distinct persons in one divine essence.

Us.note: Pronoun indicating the plurality of God, often used in reference to the Trinity.

Yahweh.note: The personal and sacred Hebrew name for God, expressing His eternal existence.

only Begotten Son.note: Phrase emphasizing the unique divine Sonship of Jesus.

the Word.note: Refers to Jesus Christ as God’s communication and revelation to humanity.
